lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
* The Deadline class to store deadline information
* Deadline constructor to initialize a deadline object with the name and time
* @param time date and time of deadline in the form of a string
* parseDate method which takes in a date in string form and converts it to a LocalDate object
* parseTime method which takes in a time in string form and converts it to a LocalTime object
* printDateTime method which takes in the date and time and converts it to String
* @return returns String of date and time
* toString method which converts the object to a String
* The Duke program can record down todos, deadlines and events and save it on your computer.
* Duke constructor to initialize a Duke object, initializes a Ui, Storage and TaskList object.
* @exception DukeException On input error and file path error.
* Main method which runs the bot
public static void main(String[] args) throws  DukeException{
* Bot method which handles the inputs and responds to the user while calling the appropriate classes
* @exception DukeException On input error and file path error.
// splits the input into the different words in order to understand what the user wants
// user sees the list of tasks
// user sets a specific task as completed
// user types something the bot does not understand
throw new DukeException("Sorry I don't know what you mean");
* The DukeException class which handles all the exceptions in the Duke program
* The event class to store event information
* Event constructor to initialize a event object with the name and time
* @param time date and time of event in the form of a string
* parseDate method which takes in a date in string form and converts it to a LocalDate object
* parseTime method which takes in a time in string form and converts it to a LocalTime object
* printDateTime method which takes in the date and time and converts it to String
* @return returns String of date and time
* toString method which converts the object to a String
* The Storage class to save the data on the computer
// file path to direct the program where to save the file
* Storage constructor to initialize a storage object which directs the path and creates a file
* @throws DukeException when the program is unable to create a new file
throw new DukeException("Failed to create new file");
* saveFile method which saves the list of tasks as a file on the computer
* @param list takes in the list of tasks
* @throws DukeException when the file path cannot be found
public void saveFile(List<Task> list) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("File path not found");
* loadFile method which retrieves the file from the path and returns the data
* @return returns the list of tasks retrieved from the file on the computer
* @throws DukeException when it is unable to load file from file path
throw new DukeException("Unable to find load file");
* The Task class to store task information
* Task constructor to initialize a task object with the name
* Task constructor to initialize a task object with the name and time
* @param time date and time of task in the form of a string
* completedTask method which marks the task as completed
* The TaskList class to handle task list functions
* TaskList constructor to initialize a TaskList object
* @param list list of tasks from the load file
* add method which takes in the user input and adds the appropriate task to the list
* @param input user input where the user specifies what he wants to add
* @throws DukeException when there is an error with the user input
public Task add(String input) throws DukeException{
throw new DukeException("Description of todo cannot be empty!");
throw new DukeException("Description of deadline cannot be empty!");
throw new DukeException("You need to specify a time!");
throw new DukeException("Description of event cannot be empty!");
throw new DukeException("You need to specify a time!");
throw new DukeException("Sorry I don't know what you mean by that");
* delete method which takes in the user input and deletes the appropriate task from the list
* @param input user input where the user specifies what he wants to delete
* @throws DukeException when there is an error with the user input
public Task delete(String input) throws DukeException{
throw new DukeException("Please key in a number");
throw new DukeException("The task does not exist");
* done method which sets a task as done
* @param num the integer of the task which the user wants to set as done
* getList method which returns the list of tasks
* countList method which returns the number of tasks in the list
* @return returns the number of tasks in the list
* deleteAll method which deletes all tasks in the list
* findWord method that goes through all the tasks in the list and returns a new list of tasks that contain the
* @return returns a new list of tasks that contain specifed word
* The todo class to store todo information
* ToDo constructor to initialize a ToDo object with the name
* toString method which converts the object to a String
* The Ui class to handle user interface methods
* drawLine method which outputs a line
* addTask method which outputs the task information
* deleteTask method which outputs the task information
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task: " + "\n" + task.toString());
* doneTask method which outputs the task information
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* listCount method which outputs the number of tasks
System.out.println("Now you have "+count+" tasks in the list.");
* bye method which outputs a message when the user exits
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* deleteAll method which outputs a message when the user deletes all tasks
* printList method which outputs all the tasks in the list
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
